comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Open a webpage and click on a "mailto" url.


Actual results:

Nothing happened. No error message, and no mail client came out.
It happens every time.


Expected results:

The mail client pops up with correct "TO line" filled.
comments.raw_text:

comments.author: hong@topbug.net
comments.creator: hong@topbug.net

comments.text: Which Action setting do you use in Edit/Preferences/Applications/mailto?
comments.raw_text: Which Action setting do you use in Edit/Preferences/Applications/mailto?
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu

comments.text:
(In reply to Thomas Ahlblom from comment #1)
> Which Action setting do you use in Edit/Preferences/Applications/mailto?

It's "always ask"
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Thomas Ahlblom from comment #1)
> Which Action setting do you use in Edit/Preferences/Applications/mailto?

It's "always ask"

bugZ@c-net.us
comments.author: bugZ@c-net.us
comments.raw_text: FYI, Seamonkey also had an issue with mailto: links for a while. With the Oct 2 nightly build, click on the link and the mail client would pop up, but the to: address was not automatically filled in. Seamonkey behaves correctly in today's build.
comments.text: FYI, Seamonkey also had an issue with mailto: links for a while. With the Oct 2 nightly build, click on the link and the mail client would pop up, but the to: address was not automatically filled in. Seamonkey behaves correctly in today's build.

comments.creator: hong@topbug.net
comments.author: hong@topbug.net
comments.text:
From this page: http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/Changing%20the%20e-mail%20program%20used%20by%20Firefox

It says that Firefox can set default mail client by selecting "Use <Program> (default)". However, I didn't see this menu item, but I did set thunderbird as my default mail client, and it works in other programs.
comments.raw_text:
